transportAdvice: Bordeaux has an extensive tram network that connects the city centre with most major tourist areas, making it easy to get around without a car. The historic centre is compact and very walkable, and taxis are readily available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cool and frequently wet with short daylight hours, typical of a mild Atlantic winter.
Still cool and damp but with occasional brighter spells as winter begins to ease.
Mild and variable with a mix of sunshine and showers as spring gets underway.
Pleasant spring weather with warming temperatures and a reasonable chance of rain.
Warm and generally sunny with occasional afternoon showers, a lovely time to visit.
Warm and mostly sunny with long evenings, marking the start of the summer season.
Hot and dry with plenty of sunshine, ideal for exploring the city and surrounding vineyards.
Consistently hot and sunny, the peak of summer with the lowest rainfall of the year.
Warm and pleasant with harvest season underway in the vineyards, an excellent time to visit.
Mild autumn temperatures with increasing cloud and rain as the season turns.
Cool and noticeably wetter with shorter days, typical of Atlantic autumn conditions.
Cold and frequently rainy with festive atmosphere in the city centre during the holiday period.
